intro: Geonoma amabilis, commonly known as the pink fern, is a species of fern native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that often display a distinctive pinkish hue. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in rainforests. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread gradually across the forest floor. The botanical features of Geonoma amabilis make it a unique and visually striking component of its natural habitat.
